remarks: X and Z are two equivalent definitions of the finite product of real functions.  Y is a set of real functions from a common domain T, Y is closed under function multiplication and U is a finite sequence of functions in Y. M is the number of functions multiplied together. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
fmuldfeq.1 $e |- F/ i ph $.
fmuldfeq.2 $e |- F/_ t Y $.
fmuldfeq.3 $e |- P = ( f e. Y , g e. Y |-> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) ) $.
fmuldfeq.4 $e |- X = ( seq 1 ( P , U ) ` M ) $.
fmuldfeq.5 $e |- F = ( t e. T |-> ( i e. ( 1 ... M ) |-> ( ( U ` i ) ` t ) ) ) $.
fmuldfeq.6 $e |- Z = ( t e. T |-> ( seq 1 ( x. , ( F ` t ) ) ` M ) ) $.
fmuldfeq.7 $e |- ( ph -> T e. _V ) $.
fmuldfeq.8 $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
fmuldfeq.9 $e |- ( ph -> U : ( 1 ... M ) --> Y ) $.
fmuldfeq.10 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. Y ) -> f : T --> RR ) $.
fmuldfeq.11 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. Y /\ g e. Y ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. Y ) $.
fmuldfeq $p |- ( ( ph /\ t e. T ) -> ( X ` t ) = ( Z ` t ) ) $.
